com.tokelon.toktales.core.game.model.entity

Class GameEntity

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tokelon.toktales.core.game.model.entity.AbstractGameEntityStateDecorator
      • com.tokelon.toktales.core.game.model.entity.GameEntity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IObservable<IGameEntity>, IParticipable<IGameEntity>, IGameEntity, IGameEntityProps, IGameEntityState
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Actor, ExtendedGameEntity, MapEntity

    public class GameEntity
extends AbstractGameEntityStateDecorator
implements IGameEntity
    How to subclass this class:
    - If you have custom observation and participation objects, you must override addInheritedObserver(IObserver), removeInheritedObserver(IObserver) , addInheritedParticipant(IParticipant), removeInheritedParticipant(IParticipant) to fulfill the interface contract.

      • adjustState

        Specified by:

      • entityAdjustCoordinateState

        public void entityAdjustCoordinateState(long timeMillis,
                                        long timePassedMillis)
        Adjusts the entity coordinates according to the given time.

        The default implementation is as follows
        1. Calculate the current velocity with entityCalculateVelocity(long)
        2. Calculate the current coordinates with entityCalculateCoordinates(long, IPoint2f)
        3. Calculate the coordinates after collision with entityCalculateCollision(IPoint2f)
        4. Assign the resulting coordinates with entityMove(IPoint2f)
        Parameters:
        timeMillis -
        timePassedMillis -

      • entityCalculateVelocity

        public IPoint2f entityCalculateVelocity(long dt)
        Calculates the entity velocity according to the given time change.
        The default implementation simply calls #getVelocity()
        Returns:
        The new entity velocity after time.

      • entityCalculateCoordinates

        Returns:

      • entityAdjustGraphicState

        public void entityAdjustGraphicState(long timeMillis,
                                     long timePassedMillis)
        Adjusts the entity graphics according to the given time.

        The default implementation works as follows
        1. If the image is enabled, it will be asked for a graphic (getGraphicsImage()).
        2. If the image is disabled or the returned graphic is null, graphic base will be used.
        3. If the graphic base is null as well, the graphic value will be null.

        Note: The graphic will only be set if it is different to the previous one.
        Parameters:
        timeMillis -
        timePassedMillis -
